H0.text: Cloning is the process during which mutations that occur in sex cells can be passed from parent to offspring.

H1.text: Budding is the process during which mutations that occur in sex cells can be passed from parent to offspring.

H2.text: Binary fission is the process during which mutations that occur in sex cells can be passed from parent to offspring.

H3.text: Sexual reproduction is the process during which mutations that occur in sex cells can be passed from parent to offspring.

A4.text: Sexual reproduction does not occur in prokaryotes, unicellular organisms without cell nuclei, such as bacteria and archaea.

A5.text: Mutations in germ cells are passed on to offspring when a mutated sperm or oocyte combine to form a zygote.

A6.text: Binary fission occurs in prokaryotes, which do not have sex cells.
